intro: Corydalis bijiangensis, commonly known as the Bijiang corydalis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant produces small, oval-shaped capsules as its fruit, containing several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral structure, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
